item.title: first
item.description:
These are some of the blogs that I’ve enjoyed following in the past few years and they’ve inspired me a lot:

  • Henry Robinson (The paper trail)
  • Salvatore Sanfilippo (antirez)
  • Peter Bailis
  • Adrian Colyer (the morning paper)

I finally decided to start blogging after reading them for a long time! :) I will discuss about new papers related to distriubtued systems and other random stuff that I find interesting. Stay tuned!

item.title: About
item.description:
I received my Ph.D. in Computer Science from Purdue University. I was affiliated with the Center for Education and Research in Information Assurance and Security (CERIAS).

I’m currently interested in designing reliable and massively scalable distributed systems. Previously, I’ve worked on multiple areas of information security.

item.title: Code
item.description:
• rook (An Open, Cloud Native, and Universal Distributed Storage): Implemented the etcd manager to elastically expand and shrink the etcd cluster based on the cluster’s status.
  • discovery service: Improved and expanded the etcd discovery service to reflect the latest cluster membership.
  • distcron: A Distributed Cron.
